maml:description.maml:para: Search AD for objects.

This cmdlet can search AD for objects matching LDAP filter. Use -LdapFilter, -SearchBase, -SearchScope, and -Properties like you would with the MS ActiveDirectory module. This cmdlet will attempt to print attributes in human-readable form where the MS ActiveDirectory prints raw data, such as lastlogontimestamp and useraccountcontrol attributes.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.
Debug output
Ldap query filter
Select properties to return
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)
Ldap query search root
Search scope. Must be Base, OneLevel, or Subtree.
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.
Debug output
Ldap query filter
Select properties to return
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)
Ldap query search root
Search scope. Must be Base, OneLevel, or Subtree.
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $RootDse = Get-ZPkiAdRootDse PS C:\> Find-ZPkiAdObject -SearchBase $RootDse.defaultnamingcontext -SearchScope Subtree -LdapFilter "(objectClass=user)"

dev:remarks.maml:para: First, get the RootDSE and use the information to search in the default domain partition for all user objects.

maml:description.maml:para: Find OID registrations in AD. Retrieve all OIDs, or filter by type and/or name.

Search objects under CN=OID, CN=Public Key Services, CN=Services in the AD forests' configuration partition. Can filter by type (template, application policy, or issuance policy) and/or by displayName.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.
Debug output
Search by name. Will match attribute displayName
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)
Search by name. Will match attribute displayName
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.
Debug output
Search by name. Will match attribute displayName
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)
Search by name. Will match attribute displayName
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.

dev:remarks.maml:para: List all OID objects in configuration partition

maml:description.maml:para: Search AD for user objects.
Similar to Find-ZPkiAdObject, but searches specifically for user objects. Filter by -Name, which will match attributes: name, displayname, cn, samaccountname, userprincipalname.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.

maml:description.maml:para: Search for certificates in local windows stores

Search for certificates matching SearchFor parameter. SearchFor will match: 1. Serial number (exact match only) 2. Thumbprint (exact match only) 3. Subject name (substring match) 4. Subject Alternative Name (substring match)
By default searching will be done in CurrentUser\My certificate store. Use GlobalSearch to search in all stores and all store locations.
Search string
Debug output
Search in all stores and locations
Search string
Debug output
Certificate store location
Certificate store name
Debug output
Search in all stores and locations
Search string
Certificate store location
Certificate store name

dev:remarks.maml:para: Search for certs in LocalMachine\My store for certs matching 'myserver.com'
Search for certs in all local stores in both CurrentUser and LocalMachine for certs matching 'myserver.com'

maml:description.maml:para: Get AD forest information
Get basic information about an AD forest, including: - fSMO masters - partitions - global catalogs
et cetera. This cmdlet shows the same information as Get-AdForest from Microsoft's ActiveDirectory module.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.
Debug output
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.
Debug output
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.
Retrieve or generate the Windows generated OID for the AD forest.

When creating new templates and OIDs in AD, Windows will use a unique OID for your forest. This value is generated when the first template or OID object is created, and is stored on the OID container in AD. This cmdlet can retrieve this value, or generate it if no templates have been created yet.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.
Debug output
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.
Debug output
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.

Get RootDSE for Active Directory. Use parameters to control which domain to connect to.

If run without parameters, cmdlet will connect to computer's joined domain. If -UserDomain is supplied, the cmdlet will connect to calling user's domain. Using -Domain or -DomainController you can connect to specific DC's, or to another domain in the forest, or any trusted forest.
Default is to connect to ADWS. Use -Rpc if you need to connect via RPC instead.
Connect to specified domain instead of current user/local computer's domain.
Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.
Debug output
Use RPC interface for querying. If false/not set, use ADWS (default)
If not set/false, connect to computer's domain. If true, connect to current user's domain.

maml:description.maml:para: Get certificate templates from AD.
List or search for templates in Active Directory. You can filter by name, template OID, or which CA that currently publishes this template.

Connect to specific domain controller. This takes precedence over both Domain and UserDomain parameter settings.

maml:description.maml:para: Parse DER encoded ASN.1 data

Parses DER encoded ASN.1 data from a file or byte array. File can be either binary DER encoded or optionally base64 (PEM) encoded. Returns a PS object or a text blob representing the ASN.1 document. This parser does not currently interpret any context specific tags. Only Universal tags are understood.
Byte array of ASN.1 encoded data
Return text representation of ASN.1 data instead of an object
Debug output
Return text representation of ASN.1 data instead of an object
Debug output
Path to ASN.1 file to parse
Byte array of ASN.1 encoded data
Return text representation of ASN.1 data instead of an object
Debug output
Path to ASN.1 file to parse

dev:remarks.maml:para: Reads certfile.cer and outputs a string representation of the ASN.1 document.

maml:description.maml:para: Query ADCS Db
Query ADCS database for rows matching given filters. You can query the request table, CRL table, or extensions table.
{{ Fill ConfigString Description }}
Debug output

Limit results to requests matching the given filters. Valid syntax: <DbColumnName><operator><value>. Operators: [==, >, >=, <, <=]. Valid DbColumnNames are any in 'certutil -c <configstring> -schema'.
Maximum number of rows to fetch at a time. Default 50 000

Properties to include in output. If you specify columns, the default columns are omitted. Default columns: RequestID, Request.Disposition, Request.RequesterName, CommonName, NotBefore, NotAfter, SerialNumber.
Database table to query. 'Cert', 'Ext', 'Attr', and 'Crl' are valid values.
{{ Fill ConfigString Description }}
Debug output

Limit results to requests matching the given filters. Valid syntax: <DbColumnName><operator><value>. Operators: [==, >, >=, <, <=]. Valid DbColumnNames are any in 'certutil -c <configstring> -schema'.
Maximum number of rows to fetch at a time. Default 50 000

Properties to include in output. If you specify columns, the default columns are omitted. Default columns: RequestID, Request.Disposition, Request.RequesterName, CommonName, NotBefore, NotAfter, SerialNumber.
Database table to query. 'Cert', 'Ext', 'Attr', and 'Crl' are valid values.
